docs.snippet: Do you prefer a commercial that pulls on your heartstrings, or one that makes you laugh?...
docs.abstract: Do you prefer a commercial that pulls on your heartstrings, or one that makes you laugh?

docs.snippet: The Cal coach, Steve Desimone, turned the lack of financial support from the university into an opportunity to fix a college model he considered broken....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cal coach, Steve Desimone, turned the lack of financial support from the university into an opportunity to fix a college model he considered broken.
docs.abstract: Profile of University of California golf coach Steve Desimone, who, for better part of four decades, has been devoted to putting student back in student-athlete; Desimone has succeeded at Cal despite receiving no direct funding from university, turning lack of financial support into golden opportunity to fix college model he considered broken; under Desimone Cal has produced 13 all-Americans and 17 all-American scholars, capturing NCAA team title in 2004 and advancing to team semifinals in 2012.

headline.seo: A Class College Golf Program, On and Off Course
headline.main: Cal Men’s Golf Team Plays and Pays Own Way to Top
headline.print_headline: Cal Men’s Golf Team Plays And Pays Own Way to Top

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite fears that reducing the practice of stop and frisk by the New York Police Department would encourage criminals and lead to more crime, the opposite seems to be true.
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes despite fears that reducing practice of stop and frisk by the New York Police Department would encourage criminals and lead to more crime, opposite seems to be true; says city in 2012 had fewest recorded homicides in 50 years.

headline.seo: Police Stops Are Down in New York; So Is Murder
headline.main: Police Stops Are Down; So Is Murder

docs.lead_paragraph: Residents of Midland City, Ala., filled pot luck dinners and prayer meetings to help law enforcement face down a violent man.
docs.abstract: Town of Midland City, Ala, celebrates the safe return of 5-year-old boy Ethan, who endured a prolonged kidnapping at the hands of Jimmy Lee Dykes; close-knit community provided pot luck dinners and prayer meetings as law enforcement faced down the kidnapper.

headline.seo: Midland City Wins Its Battle With Kidnapper
headline.main: Small Town Wins Its Standoff With a Kidnapper
headline.print_headline: Small Town Wins Its Standoff With a Kidnapper

docs.snippet: League Park, formerly a home of the Cleveland Indians, has remained virtually untouched since the stadium was razed in 1951, but it is expected to reopen later this year in turn-back-the-clock glory....
docs.lead_paragraph: League Park, formerly a home of the Cleveland Indians, has remained virtually untouched since the stadium was razed in 1951, but it is expected to reopen later this year in turn-back-the-clock glory.
docs.abstract: League Park, formerly a home to Cleveland Indians, is being restored; site will feature baseball fields, visitor center and museum and is expected to reopen in late 2013.

headline.seo: In Cleveland, Bringing Back Baseball History and a Neighborhood
